column5: Hi Guys / Gals,  I will be attending a family BBQ at Petticoat Creek, are there any   opportunities in that park?  According to the area map, there seem to be a creek, right underneath a pedestrian bridge emptying into the lake. Any local knowledge is appreciated.  Thanks,  Anton

Check out this document....  http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/STEL02_163569.pdf  There is a section for Petticoat creek....looks like only creek chub and suckers are prevalent there, with the occasional bass and panfish opportunities.  Trout are seasonal....probably a bit early for those.  Good luck.
Thanks, I guess worms will do...

I would consider Peticoat to be more of stream than a creek.  There is not a whole lot of water flowing through it.  It may get a seasonal run of trout, but I have never heard it mentioned as a trout fishing destination.
